column4: hi everyone,  i'm installing kubuntu to use for development.  the main server machine is ubuntu 8.04... my question is will Kubuntu 8.10
Kubuntu 8.10 beta have the same repo content as ubuntu 8.04 ?
also can kubuntu 8.10 Beta be upgraded to non-beta without a reinstall ?   thanks
yes, but its not advisable
i see.  so it's better if i wait for kubuntu 8.10 Final ?   do you know where i can check the timeline for that ?
october 30'th
8.10  and 8.10 will be in sync
8.10 and 8.04 version will not be compatible
so what if i use "Kubuntu 8.04 KDE4 Remix" ... won't that give me the coolness of kde4 and the compatiblity of 8.04 with the 8.04 server ?
8.04 desktop and server are compatible anyway
you don't need a "remix" or anything like that
sorry i meant will the KDE4 remix of 8.04 = ubuntu 8.04 in terms of  underneath packages in the repos ?
what you are saying makes no sense
there is no need for any remix
so how can i get kde4 on kubuntu 8.04 then ?
the 8.04 packages are up to date and maintained and compatible with any ubuntu 8.04 problem
install the kde4 packages
ah i see :)
they are int eh 8.04 repos
ok great.  so 8.10 is out of the picture then,  even though it looks soo cool  :)
you can use 8.10 if you want, but not with a 8.04 base

one last question please,  is my understanding correct that an ubuntu 8.10 will also come out... and will have an updated "base" which will not be the same packages as with 8.04.. so for example it may have lib-readline 1.3  instead of lib-readline 1.1  right ?
correct
alright then.  thanks for the help
